FuncDef: The ap command enables you to use a master to log in to an AP and manage and view AP configurations.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an AP, which has been configured using the ap name command.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters, spaces not supported. The first character cannot be a digit or an underscore (_).
When quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the management IP address of an AP.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Virtual cluster access enables you to use a master to log in to an AP and manage and view AP configurations. You can use either of the following methods to log in to an AP:
Use the AP's management IP address: You can use the AP's management IP address to establish a Telnet connection and log in to the AP.Use the AP's name. You must run the ap name command on a master to configure a name for the AP. You can then use the name to establish a Telnet connection and log in to the AP.

Follow-up Procedure
Modify or view AP configurations.
